bboxes.raw_text:
WASHINGTON = At the opening
session of the second American
Negro Leadership Conference on
Africa, DR.. James H. Robinson,
founder and director of Operation
Crossroads Africa. charged the
conference with the "responsi-
bility of serving as a catalytic
agent in helping to relate Africa
and America"


G. Mennen Williams, Assistant
Secretary of State for African
Affairs. also appeared. He re-
viewed the history of American
Negro interest in Africa citing

MOSCOW Miss Leontyne
Price was applauded thr ough l6
curtain calls and almost mobbed
by fans at her Mos COW debut last
week. She sang while suffering
from bronchitis.


a 26-minute ovation for the
Negro opera singer from Laurel.
MISS, was one of the longest
ever given a visiting artist at the
Bolshoi Theatre. Mrs. Nina
Mrushchev, the premier's wife,
Joined in the applause.

DR.. Robinson said the con-
ference must keep before both
the legislative and executive
branches Of government. as well
as the people of the United
States. the need to improve.
strengthen and enlarge our con-
structive policies towards Afri-
ca. 1t has the responsibility Of
developing better communica-
lions and relations between the
American Negro community and
Africa and of devising an
effective strategy for transform
ing its aims and detectives into
positive and constructive
action"

particularly the monumental
work of the late WEB. Dubois,
a founder of the National Associa-
tion for the Advancement of
Colored People and. through the
NAACP. pioneer in the es-
Establishment Of the Pan-African
Congress.


The United States, Mr.. Will
liams said, does not propose to
tell African states how to run
their affairs, nor does this coun-
try propose to see non-African
nations intervening into African
affairs.

BOSTON Joe Louis Barrow.
IT., son of the former heavy
weight boxing champion Joe
Louis, is a freshman at Boston
University.


A graduate of the University OF
Chicagos high school division.
Barrow is enr oiled in the G ollege
of Basic Studies. He plans to
enter law or medicine.
